comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do no edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: date_trunc
description: Rounds down a date to the closest interval.

params.name: interval
params.description: Interval; expressed using the timespan literal syntax.

params.name: interval
params.description: Interval; expressed using the timespan literal syntax.

examples:
FROM employees
| KEEP first_name, last_name, hire_date
| EVAL year_hired = DATE_TRUNC(1 year, hire_date)

FROM employees
| EVAL year = DATE_TRUNC(1 year, hire_date)
| STATS hires = COUNT(emp_no) BY year
| SORT year

FROM sample_data
| EVAL error = CASE(message LIKE "*error*", 1, 0)
| EVAL hour = DATE_TRUNC(1 hour, @timestamp)
| STATS error_rate = AVG(error) by hour
| SORT hour
